outline: Rob was upset about some things the city council was doing.
Lisa had a house cat Ruffles.
Mark entered his work in the art fair.
Rob organized a petition and collected numerous signatures.
Luckily Lisa caught Ruffles in time.
Mark made $10,000 on the one piece!
Thankfully, Rob was able to prevent the measure from being implemented.
response:
Rob was upset about some things the city council was doing. The latest decision to cut funding for the local park renovation had been the final straw. He felt it was his duty to take action. Meanwhile, Lisa was enjoying a quiet evening at home with her mischievous house cat Ruffles. Mark, a local artist, was busy preparing for the upcoming art fair, carefully selecting his best pieces to showcase.

One day, Rob discovered that the city council was planning to implement a new measure that would further harm the community. He decided to take a stand and organized a petition to collect signatures from fellow citizens who opposed the measure. Around the same time, Lisa's cat Ruffles got into trouble, knocking over a vase and causing a mess. Luckily, Lisa caught Ruffles in time, saving her beloved pet from injury.

As Rob worked tirelessly on his petition, Mark was putting the final touches on his art pieces. The art fair was just around the corner, and he was hoping to make a name for himself in the local art scene. Lisa, still shaken by the close call with Ruffles, was grateful to have her pet safe and sound.

Rob's petition quickly gained momentum, with numerous signatures pouring in from concerned citizens. Mark's art piece, titled "Urban Landscape," was a huge hit at the art fair, and he made an astonishing $10,000 on the one piece! The fair was a whirlwind of activity, but Mark was thrilled with the outcome.

With the petition complete, Rob presented it to the city council, urging them to reconsider their decision. The council was impressed by the sheer number of signatures and the passion of the citizens. After a heated debate, they finally agreed to reverse their decision, thanks to Rob's tireless efforts. Thankfully, Rob was able to prevent the measure from being implemented, saving the community from further harm.

As the news spread, Lisa was relieved that her cat Ruffles was safe, and Mark was celebrating his financial success. Rob, exhausted but triumphant, felt a sense of pride and accomplishment. The community was forever grateful to him for standing up against the city council's misguided decisions.

The only connection is that both Lisa and Rob are part of the same community, but their stories do not intersect or interact in any significant way.

outline: Sam saw his brother Barry eating a peanut butter and banana sandwich.

response:
Sam and his brother Barry were hanging out in the kitchen when Sam noticed Barry eating a peculiar sandwich - peanut butter and banana. Sam had never tried such a combination before and was hesitant to do so. Barry, however, encouraged Sam to give it a shot, saying it was his new favorite snack. But Sam refused, sticking to his usual lunch preferences.

Meanwhile, their friend Holly had always dreamed of pursuing a Master's in Public Health. She had worked hard, earning top grades and completing impressive internships. Her dedication was about to pay off, as she was waiting to hear back from her top-choice graduate program.

Across town, Cameron was spending the afternoon at the playground. As he was swinging on the swings, he noticed his friend struggling to find someone to play with on the see-saw. Cameron agreed to help out, and together they soared up and down, laughing and having a blast.

Back at Sam's house, Barry was still trying to convince Sam to try the peanut butter and banana sandwich. But Sam remained stubborn, refusing to budge. Barry shrugged and finished his lunch, leaving Sam to wonder what he was missing.

The next day, Holly received an email that changed her life - she had been accepted into her top-choice graduate program! Overjoyed, she shared the news with Sam, Barry, and Cameron, who all celebrated her achievement.

As they were congratulating Holly, Barry pulled out another peanut butter and banana sandwich. This time, Sam surprised everyone by asking for a bite. He took a hesitant bite, and to his surprise, he loved it! From that day on, Sam made it a point to eat peanut butter and banana sandwiches every week.

As Holly prepared to start her graduate program, Sam, Barry, and Cameron all supported her, proud of her accomplishment. And whenever they hung out, Sam would make sure to bring his new favorite snack to share with the group.

Cindy loved her coworkers, but for some reason, she had never joined them for happy hour. She always made excuses, but deep down, she was hesitant to socialize with them outside of the office.

Meanwhile, Nellie was having a relaxing day at the beach. She had brought a book and was soaking up the sun when she dozed off on the sand.

Annie, on the other hand, was at a quilt show, surrounded by vibrant fabrics and intricate patterns. As she walked through the exhibit, she couldn't help but remember standing at the same show last year.

One day, Cindy's best friend at work, Rachel, approached her with a persuasive smile. "Come on, Cindy, just one happy hour! We'll have fun, I promise!" Cindy hesitated, but Rachel's enthusiasm was infectious. She finally agreed to join them.

As Cindy sipped her drink and chatted with her coworkers, she couldn't believe she had almost missed out on this. They were laughing and joking, and Cindy felt like she was finally part of the group. Rachel had been right; she was having the time of her life.

As the conversation turned to summer vacations, Nellie's story came up. She had fallen asleep on the sand, and her little brother had taken advantage of the situation, burying her in a mountain of sand. The group erupted in laughter at the thought of Nellie's sandy predicament.

Annie, who had been quietly observing the group, chimed in with her own story. She had earned an honorable mention ribbon at the quilt show she was attending, and her pride was still evident on her face.

As the night wore on, Cindy realized that she had been missing out on these moments of connection with her coworkers. She was thrilled that she had finally taken the leap and joined them for happy hour. As she left the bar with her new friends, Cindy felt a sense of satisfaction and belonging. outline: Larry awakes one night to a sound.

Larry awakes one night to a sound that seems to be coming from downstairs. He lies in bed for a moment, wondering if he should investigate, but his curiosity gets the better of him. He throws off the covers and heads down the stairs into the kitchen, flipping on the light switch as he enters.

The kitchen is empty, but he notices a piece of paper on the counter with a note from his wife, Kelly. She had written that she was upset and had gone out for a walk to clear her head. Larry wonders what's wrong and decides to wait up for her return.

As he waits, he thinks about his friend David, who had been in business for 10 years. David had been struggling lately, and Kelly had been helping him with his marketing strategy. Larry recalls that Kelly had gotten her nails done earlier that day, probably to take her mind off the stress of David's business woes.

Just then, Kelly walks in the door, looking frazzled. Larry asks her what's wrong, and she explains that David's business was on the verge of bankruptcy. He had been trying to get more visibility online, but it wasn't working. Kelly had been trying to help him, but it seemed like nothing was working.

Larry listens sympathetically, and then remembers that David had told him about paying an SEO firm to put his business on the front page of Google. Maybe that would be the solution to his problems.

Kelly nods, looking hopeful, and the two of them go to bed, feeling a sense of resolution. Larry heads back to bed and rests easily, knowing that his friend's business troubles might soon be over.

outline: Ronald was taking intro to Anatomy.

response:
Ronald sat nervously in his intro to Anatomy class, clutching his textbook as if it were a lifeline. Having been sheltered all his life, he had no idea what to really expect from the class. As the instructor began to explain the intricacies of the human body, Ronald's eyes widened in confusion.

Marcus, who sat next to Ronald, noticed his distress and introduced himself. "Hey, I'm Marcus. I've been having some issues with dizziness in the mornings," he said, trying to break the ice. Ronald's eyes lit up with curiosity, and he asked Marcus what was causing his dizziness. Marcus explained that his doctor had told him it was due to low blood pressure, and that he simply needed to make some lifestyle changes to alleviate the problem.

Just then, Kate walked into the classroom, looking disappointed. "What's wrong?" Ronald asked her. Kate sighed and said, "I watched the lotto drawing last night and checked my ticket. I thought I had won the jackpot, but it turns out I didn't." The group commiserated with Kate, and Marcus shared his own experience of following the doctor's advice and solving his dizziness problem.

As the class progressed, Ronald found himself learning not only about anatomy but also about the importance of taking care of one's health. He realized that his sheltered upbringing had left him clueless about many things, and he was grateful for his classmates' willingness to share their experiences.

As they left the classroom, the group giggled and joked together. Ronald turned to Marcus and Kate and said, "Thanks, guys. I learned quite a few things today, not just about anatomy." Marcus smiled and said, "That's what friends are for." Kate nodded in agreement, and the three of them walked out of the classroom together, ready to face their next challenge.

outline: Ray was looking for a birthday present for his mom.

Ray was determined to find the perfect birthday present for his mom. He wanted something that would make her feel special and loved. As he was browsing through the mall, he stumbled upon a fitness studio and decided to ask one of the instructors for advice. The instructor, a fit and energetic woman, recommended a Fitbit, citing its ability to track daily activities and promote a healthy lifestyle.

Meanwhile, Joel, a retired man, was sitting in his armchair, surrounded by stacks of savings bonds and piggy banks. He was notorious for being stingy with his money, always looking for ways to save a buck. But as he gazed out the window, he couldn't help but feel a pang of regret. He had worked hard all his life, but what did he have to show for it? A bunch of useless trinkets and a lonely retirement. He wished he had spent more time and money on experiences and people he loved.

Across town, Gina was watching her mom slowly pack away her grandmother's belongings. It was a difficult task, but someone had to do it. Gina decided to take a break from her own activities and help her mom with the packing. She spent three hours sorting through old photographs and heirlooms, listening to her mom's stories and memories.

Back to Ray, he took the instructor's advice to heart and purchased the Fitbit. He couldn't wait to see his mom's face light up when she opened the gift. On her birthday, he presented it to her with a big smile. His mom was taken aback by the thoughtful gift, and her eyes sparkled with delight. She hugged Ray tightly, thanking him for the wonderful present.

As Ray's mom began to explore her new Fitbit, Joel sat in his armchair, feeling a sense of nostalgia wash over him. He realized that it was never too late to change his ways, to start spending his money on experiences and people that brought him joy. And Gina, well, she learned the value of taking time to help others and cherish the memories of those who came before her.

But when Donna's son finally started to turn his life around, Joel saw the relief and joy it brought to Donna's face. It was a turning point for Joel. He realized that he had been so focused on accumulating wealth that he had forgotten to live.

When Lola's beach trip was unexpectedly cancelled due to bad weather, she was devastated. Joel saw how disappointed she was and felt a pang of regret. He realized that he had wasted his life being stingy and not taking advantage of opportunities to enjoy himself.

In that moment, Joel decided to change his ways. He started small, buying himself a nice lunch and taking a walk in the park. But as he continued to reflect on his life, he realized that he wanted to do more. He started taking vacations, buying gifts for his friends and family, and even donating to charity.

Joel finally felt alive, and he was grateful for the lesson he had learned. He realized that money was meant to be used, not hoarded. And as he looked back on his life, he was thankful that he had finally learned to appreciate the value of living in the present.

response:
Becky wanted to impress her pals, so she spent her Saturday morning walking along the road, picking up rocks to fill the spaces in her decorative garden. She carefully selected each rock, making sure they were unique and colorful.

As she was collecting rocks, Tim woke up early, feeling a bit peckish. He stumbled into the kitchen and poured himself a bowl of cereal. When Becky's pals begged, Becky let them each keep a rock, and Tim, who was visiting, was fascinated by the rocks. He decided to try something unusual ‚Äì he kept eating the cereal after it soaked in the milk a bit, and then, on a whim, he started to crunch on one of the rocks Becky's friends had taken.

Meanwhile, Dina, Becky's friend, was getting married in two weeks and was a nervous wreck. She hoped she wouldn't be so nervous on the actual day of the wedding. Becky, wanting to help her friend, offered to create a beautiful rock arrangement for the wedding decor. Dina was thrilled, and Becky felt proud to be a part of her special day.

However, when Tim's eating habit affected the rock collection, Becky was devastated. Her friends were impressed by the rocks, but now they were dwindling in number. Becky felt concerned for Dina's wedding and the rocks she had promised to provide.

As the wedding day approached, Dina's nervousness only grew. Becky, determined to help her friend, walked along the road, picking up rocks to refill the collection. Her friends appreciated her effort, and soon, the decorative garden was restored to its former beauty.

On the day of the wedding, Becky's rock arrangement was a stunning centerpiece, and Dina, surrounded by her friends and loved ones, felt a sense of calm wash over her. As they exchanged their vows, Becky smiled, knowing she had played a small part in making Dina's special day truly unforgettable.

outline: Cody had really nice skin until he was about 8 years old.
Sam loved to fish.
Ray worked in the fashion industry.
As time went on Cody's skin began to peel and it would cause Cody pain.
Sam wanted the fish so badly Sam dived in after it!
The risk paid off, and Ray started a new trend altogether.
Cody was then prescribed special lotions and now Cody's skin is better.
response:
As a young boy, Cody was known for his radiant, unblemished skin. Up until the age of 8, he had a complexion that many people envied. However, as time went on, Cody's skin began to peel and flake, causing him immense pain. His parents took him to see multiple doctors, but none could seem to find a solution to his condition.

Meanwhile, Sam, a family friend, loved to fish in the nearby lake. He spent every spare moment by the water, waiting for a bite. One day, Sam spotted the biggest fish he had ever seen. His desire to catch it was overwhelming, and in a moment of reckless abandon, Sam dove into the water after it! The risk paid off, and he emerged victorious, holding the massive fish aloft.

Ray, a renowned fashion designer, was at the lake that day, taking inspiration from the natural surroundings for his next collection. As he watched Sam's dramatic fishing attempt, an idea struck him. He approached Cody's parents and offered to design a clothing line specifically for people with skin conditions like Cody's. The clothes would be gentle on the skin and provide comfort to those who needed it most.

Ray's innovative response to Cody's condition sparked a new trend in the fashion industry. His designs became popular not only among those with skin conditions but also among people who valued comfort and sustainability. The risk Ray took in pursuing this new direction paid off, and his brand flourished.

As for Cody, his parents were thrilled to discover that Ray's designs were not the only solution to his skin problems. After consulting with a dermatologist, Cody was prescribed special lotions that would help to soothe and heal his skin. With regular application and care, Cody's skin began to improve, and he was finally able to live a life free from the pain and discomfort that had plagued him for so long.

60

The subplot of Sam's fishing adventure is somewhat integrated into the main narrative. Sam's reckless dive into the lake to catch the fish inspires Ray, a fashion designer, to take a risk and design a clothing line for people with skin conditions like Cody's. However, the subplot is not indispensable to the main storyline. The main narrative could still progress without Sam's subplot, as Cody's skin condition and Ray's response to it are the central focus of the story.

85

The subplot of Ray working in the fashion industry and starting a new trend is well integrated into the main narrative. Ray's inspiration for his new clothing line comes directly from witnessing Cody's struggle with his skin condition, making his subplot directly relevant to the main plot. However, it is not completely indispensable as Cody's story could still progress without Ray's subplot, hence the score is not a full 100.
